>
> telling people to shut up just because they have the "team badge" is not exactly good behaviour ...

Didnt say shut-up. i said dont talk shit to other players.

Examples:
Dont be toxic
Dont be passive agressive
Dont expect to be carried for nothing and feed
Dont tell others to kill themselves.
Dont tell others they should uninstall
Dont tell others they gave you cancer 

Don't say any of those comments when your 0/5/0 and only at your elo because you were carried.

Those a fine examples of "talking shit"

Most of the players I've come across who exhibit these behaviours mostly have this badge. Ironicly. they are also the main reason matches are lost in the first place.



**Cant say anything nice to other players?, Don't say anything at all!**

**Simple really
**

Very likely.

If anything, the boards, Reddit and other Social platforms have affirmed it can shape behaviour and even change the mindset of other people and even riot itself. (business platforms and how they interact with its consumer base)

Social Networking is a powerful recourse. and is one of the main reasons why something will become popular or is condemned.
If it becomes condemned in social media, most will behave like sheep and change their mindset or at least think differently or reflect upon themselves.

The way you're saying it, it'll just stir up the players even more, not fix the problem lol

Telling someone not to talk shit is pretty much asking them to talk shit

When you make someone aware that their behaviour isnt okay, it makes them think about their actions.
